wikipedia_page.main: Adam Kelso Fulton (10 April 1929 – 27 August 1994) was a Scottish rugby union internationalist. Positioned as scrum-half, he was capped twice playing both games against France at Murrayfield in 1952 and 1954. His association with the sport started at school, Dollar Academy, where he was also a Scottish Schools' internationalist, and continued with a number of teams including Edinburgh University, Leamington RFC and The Army.He worked at the Royal Infirmary,  Edinburgh in the years he played for Scotland. Nurses remember him drying his kit in the scullary attached to the ward.
